Train the SM2007 model

Source: R/SM2007.R
SM2007.Rd

Train the SM2007 model

Usage

SM2007(
  alphas,
  lambdas,
  omegas,
  rhos,
  gammas,
  taus,
  orders,
  V = NULL,
  O = NULL,
  experience,
  mapping,
  debug = F,
  comparator_func = .witnauer_comparator_proc,
  ...
)

Arguments

alphas

A named vector with stimulus saliences.

lambdas

A named vector with learning asymptotes.

omegas

A named vector with weakening rates (extinction).

rhos

A named vector with weights for activation of present stimuli.

gammas

A named vector with weights for contribution of each stimulus in comparison processes.

taus

A named vector with stimulus-specific rates for operator switch.

orders

An integer specifying the order of the comparison process. Defaults to 1.

V

(optional) A named matrix of dimensions S,S (the associative strengths); where S is the number of stimuli.

O

(optional) A named matrix of dimensions S,S,S (the operator switches).

experience

A data.frame specifying trials as rows, as returned by make_model_args

mapping

A named list specifying trial and stimulus mapping, as returned by make_model_args

debug

A logical specifying whether to print information for the comparison process. Defaults to FALSE.

comparator_func

A function to be used in the comparison process. Either .witnauer_comparator_funcor .comparator_func.

Value

A list with

  • vs, Array of dimensions P,S,S; where P is the number of trials used to train the model and S is the number of stimuli involved in the experiment. Contains stimulus association strengths.

  • acts As above but with stimulus activations.

  • relacts As above but with (relative) stimulus activations after comparison process.

  • os Array of dimensions P,S,S,S, with the state of the operator switches. See notes related to O parameter.

  • other, Carryover arguments used for further processing by other functions

Note

Correct usage of the V and O parameters requires the matrices to adhere to a specific format. For V, entry i,j represents the association from stimulus i to stimulus j. For O, entry i,k,j represents the operator switch between stimulus i and comparator k with respect to stimulus j.
